SENT.plain: An infarctus of medulla oblongata was discovered in a 44-year old man with an intractable hiccup and 10, 11th and 12th right cranial nerves palsies
Systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) with antiphospholipid syndrome was subsequently diagnosed
Hiccup has withdrew with corticosteroid therapy and low-dose aspirin
The other cases of literature and pathophysiologic hypotheses are briefly reported
